headline: Britain to investigate Muslim Brotherhood
content: Prime Minister David Cameron orders probe of group's activities in UK, citing its "alleged links to violent extremism".

headline: Russia pulls some troops from Ukraine border
content: Defence Ministry announces withdrawal of one battalion, a day after US and Russia held talks in Paris.

headline: France gets new PM following election losses
content: The Socialist party suffered heavy losses in municipal elections on Sunday, prompting the appointment of Manuel Valls.

headline: Turkish PM claims landslide election win
content: Erdogan's AKP gets more than 45 percent of votes in local polls seen as a vote of confidence amid graft allegations.

headline: Syrian army retakes key post in Latakia
content: Syrian state television says government troops have captured a key position in Latakia seized last week by rebels.

headline: Egypt court denies bail to Al Jazeera staff
content: Cairo court adjourns trial a fourth time for three journalists, as they approach 100 days since their arrest.

headline: US ambassador to India resigns
content: Nancy Powell to retire after helping to mend US-India ties following the arrest of an Indian diplomat in New York.

headline: Living with fire in India's Jharia
content: About 700,000 people in eastern Jharkhand state live amid fires triggered by mining of coal from the surface.

headline: Uganda president leads anti-gay rally
content: Yoweri Museveni tells supporters his country can live without aid that donors suspended in protest at controversial law.

headline: MSF: Guinea Ebola outbreak unprecedented
content: Aid agency says Zaire strain of Ebola virus most aggressive and deadly, killing nine out of 10 patients.

headline: Mexico vigilante leader accused of murder
content: Enrique Hernandez Salcedo has been arrested for allegedly ordering the March 22 murder of Mayor Gustavo Garibay.

headline: Jamaican police officers charged with murder
content: Investigators say officers from Clarendon parish were involved in unlawful killing of civilians.

headline: French socialists hit hard in local elections
content: Early results show far-right National Front taking control of 14 towns as voters shun left-wing President Hollande.

headline: Russia presses call for federal Ukraine
content: US-Russia talks fail to end crisis, with Russia presenting vision of Ukraine's future while US calls for troop pullback.

headline: Lufthansa cancels 3,800 flights due to strike
content: Airline to lose out on tens of millions of euros as pilots plan three-day strike over cut in early retirement contract.

headline: Turkey accused of sending fighters to Syria
content: Damascus says Ankara sends foreign fighters to Syria to fight government troops.

headline: Israel offers Palestinians new talks proposal
content: The move aims to prevent collapse of peace process, after Tel Aviv failed to free 26 Palestinian prisoners.

headline: Sisi mocked in Egypt internet campaign
content: Presidential hopeful subject of sarcastic 'vote for the pimp' movement on social media, leading to calls for a ban.

headline: 'Thankful' Sri Lanka to free Indian fishermen
content: President Rajapaksa orders release of fishermen detained for poaching to thank India for abstaining from UN rights vote.

headline: Afghans register for polls despite attacks
content: Voters remain defiant and rush to register for Saturday's election despite numerous recent Taliban attacks.

headline: UN warns of climate change risks
content: The effects of global warming could spiral 'out of control' if the world does not cut pollution, new UN report says.

headline: Liberia confirms Ebola's arrival from Guinea
content: Government says patient dies after catching disease in Guinea, where 70 have died in one of worst outbreaks for years.

headline: Nigerian prisoners killed in Abuja jailbreak
content: At least 21 detainees shot dead during attempted escape from the cells of the secret police headquarters in Abuja.

headline: Rio police storm favela in dawn operation
content: More than 1,000 police backed by military and armoured vehicles occupy vast favela near Rio de Janeiro's airport.

headline: Venezuela troops take back protest-torn city
content: Army and police dismantle barricades in San Cristobal following operation to drive out anti-government protesters.

headline: US officials cut number missing in landslide
content: Number of people presumed missing after Washington state disaster drops from 90 to 30 after many are confirmed alive.

headline: UN court rules against Japan whaling
content: International Court of Justice rules whale hunting is not for scientific purposes, and orders Tokyo to revoke permits.

headline: Spanish journalists home after Syria ordeal
content: Javier Espinosa and Ricardo Garcia Vilanova were greeted by family in Madrid after six months in captivity in Syria.

headline: Slovakia elects political novice as president
content: Andrej Kiska, a millionaire philanthropist, trounces current PM, Robert Fico, in run-off vote for the presidency.

headline: Syria leak prompts espionage probe in Turkey
content: Embroiled in political turmoil, Turkey's leader vows to pursue his adversaries in the run-up to Sunday's elections.

headline: Israeli ex-PM Olmert convicted of corruption
content: Tel Aviv district court finds former prime minister Ehud Olmert guilty of corruption linked to property development.

headline: Spanish journalists home after Syria ordeal
content: Javier Espinosa and Ricardo Garcia Vilanova were greeted by family in Madrid after six months in captivity in Syria.

headline: Egypt presidential poll set for late May
content: Field Marshal Abdel Fattah el-Sisi widely expected to win the election in the first round,  to be held on May 26 and 27.

headline: Italy seeks US help for marines held in India
content: Prime minister calls for international efforts to resolve case involving two marines accused of killing two fishermen.

headline: Chadian troops shoot dead civilians in CAR
content: Authorities are trying to find out what led Chadian troops to shoot and kill at least 24 civilians in the capital.

headline: Ebola scare forces Senegal to close borders
content: Guinea records more cases and deaths, as Senegal shuts crossings amid reports of cases in other neighbouring states.

headline: Cuba passes law to attract foreign investors
content: New law aims to make the island nation more attractive to foreign investment as economy struggles to improve.

headline: Mexico finds abandoned immigrant children
content: Hundreds of children, mainly from Central America, found across Mexico after traffickers pledged to take them to the US.

headline: Earthquake rattles Los Angeles
content: Magnitude-5.1 quake strikes Los Angeles and surrounding counties, causing rockslide and at least five aftershocks.

headline: UN warns of climate change risks
content: The effects of global warming could spiral 'out of control' if the world does not cut pollution, new UN report says.

headline: Rival Koreas trade fire across sea border
content: Washington and Moscow express concern about fresh tensions on the Korean peninsula after firing of shells.

headline: Fiji travel ban lifted on promise of election
content: Australia and NZ lift restrictions eight years after coup by Frank Bainimarama following his announcement of elections.

headline: Deaths in attack on Iraq police patrol
content: Eight people killed, including a mother and three children, in Baghdad attack, one of several to take place on Sunday.

headline: Deaths in Iraq shooting and suicide attacks
content: Soldiers and civilians attacked by gunfire and a suicide car bombing in Sunni-majority areas a month before elections.

headline: UN general assembly calls Crimea vote illegal
content: One hundred nations declare Crimea referendum illegal, with 11 against and 58 abstaining in largely symbolic resolution.

headline: US car company recalls millions of vehicles
content: GM extends global recall to 2.1m cars over a potentially deadly ignition fault that can cut engines at high speed.

headline: Giant hailstones batter Hong Kong
content: Hailstones smash windows at a shopping mall as observatory records nearly 9,000 lighting strikes in one hour.

headline: Thousands of Taiwanese protest China pact
content: Tens of thousands take to streets of Taipei to pressure president to retract controversial trade agreement with China.

headline: Thais vote for senators as PM showdown looms
content: Outcome of upper house ballot could influence decision to remove prime minister which requires three-fifths vote.

headline: Tensions rise as Myanmar holds census
content: Buddhist nationalists threaten to boycott tally over fears it could lead to recognition for Rohingyas.

headline: China seizes $14.5bn of ex-official assets
content: Illegal assets were seized from family members and associates of retired domestic security chief Zhou Yongkang.

headline: Climate change 'complicates' global security
content: Top scientists say climate change will complicate and worsen global security problems such as wars and refugees.
